annotation.text: Moreover, a dominant negative STAT3 adenovirus (Ad ST3-DN) enhanced apoptotic cell death (81.2 +- 6.9%) compared to control infected NRVM (46.0 +- 3.1%) following I/R.
a STAT3Y705F mutant enhances I/R-induced cell death
a STAT3Y705F mutant enhances I/R-induced cell death

This mutant has been shown to act as a dominant negative (ST3-DN) [23]. Importantly, this approach using an adenoviral STAT3Y705F allows us to transduce > 90% of NRVM and as indicated in Fig. 1C, ST3-DN enhanced significantly the effects of I/R-induced death to 81.2 +- 6.9% compared with control (GFP) infected cells 46.0 +- 3.

This mutant has been shown to act as a dominant negative (ST3-DN) [23]. Importantly, this approach using an adenoviral STAT3Y705F allows us to transduce > 90% of NRVM and as indicated in Fig. 1C, ST3-DN enhanced significantly the effects of I/R-induced death to 81.2 +- 6.9% compared with control (GFP) infected cells 46.0 +- 3.
